Viral video on social media: The expert's verdict mentions that a video of a crowd of demonstrators holding a mock funeral procession has been going viral on social media. This viral video is the main claim that is being analyzed for authenticity.
Slogan against Shivraj Singh Chouhan: The video shows the crowd chanting a Hindi slogan which translates to, “He has murderous intentions just like Lord Krishna’s uncle, Kuns.” This slogan is mentioned in the expert's verdict and adds to the claim's context.
Facebook posts and views: The claim is supported by the fact that a Facebook page called 'Madhya Pradesh Congress' posted the video, which has garnered more than 2.7 lakh views. Additionally, another Facebook user posted the same video, which gathered more than 6,000 views. These posts and views provide evidence of the video's circulation on social media.
Previous protest in 2018: The expert's verdict mentions that the video has been falsely linked to the upcoming by-elections in Madhya Pradesh. It is clarified that the video is actually from a protest held in 2018 by ASHA and USHA workers against MP CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan. This aspect helps verify the authenticity of the claim by providing historical context and clarifying the timeline of the protest.
